offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p1: I hereby request cost coverage for off-label prescription of {{medicationIngredient}} to treat {{diagnosisMain}}.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p11.manual: Additionally, the following treatment attempts were undertaken: {{enteredPriorMeasuresListText}}
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p2: The prerequisites for off-label coverage are met: this is a serious condition without a generally accepted standard therapy. There is a not-remote prospect of meaningful positive impact on disease course or symptom burden.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p3: For {{diagnosisMain}}, no causal standard therapy is currently available. Care is symptom-oriented and individualized.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p5: In addition, I request cost coverage with explicit consideration of Section 2(1a) SGB V. In severe courses with no sufficiently effective standard options, individual coverage may be considered when there is a not-remote prospect of a meaningful positive impact on disease course. For classification of the ME/CFS care situation and application of Section 2(1a) SGB V, I refer to the decision of LSG Niedersachsen-Bremen dated 2022-10-14 (L 4 KR 373/22 B ER; attachment/source).

offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p9: I request a written decision within statutory deadlines. I am available for follow-up questions.

offlabel-antrag.export.part2.p2: I am preparing a cost-coverage request (part 1) to my insurer for an off-label prescription. I kindly ask for your support via a brief medical statement/findings summary (medical necessity, severity, prior measures, expected benefit, monitoring).

offlabel-antrag.export.part2.p4: Important: Part 1 is my letter to the insurer and is not signed by you. Please provide a separate medical statement/findings summary as an attachment instead. A pre-formulated template (Part 3) is included and can be adapted by your practice.

offlabel-antrag.export.severity.bell.ass: I have continuously severe symptoms, am permanently bedbound, and cannot carry out even basic self-care activities independently.
I have severe symptoms even at rest, am bedbound most of the time, and cannot leave the house. Marked cognitive symptoms prevent reliable concentration.
I have no symptoms at rest and no symptoms during physical exertion. My activity level is normal overall, and I can work full-time without difficulty.

I have moderate to severe symptoms at rest and severe symptoms with any exertion. My functional state is reduced to about 30% to 50% of normal. I can leave the house only rarely, am bedbound for most of the day, and can usually concentrate for no more than one hour per day.

I have moderate to severe symptoms at rest and severe symptoms with any exertion. My functional state is about 50% of normal. I am usually housebound and can perform light or desk-based work for only 2 to 3 hours per day with rest breaks.

I have moderate symptoms at rest and moderate to severe symptoms with exertion. My functional state is reduced to about 50% to 70% of normal. Strenuous work is not possible; light or desk-based work is possible for about 3 to 4 hours per day with rest breaks.

I have moderate symptoms at rest and moderate to severe symptoms with exertion. My functional state is reduced to about 70% of normal. Strenuous work is not possible; light or desk-based work is possible for about 4 to 5 hours per day with rest breaks.

I have mild symptoms at rest with clear limits in daily activities. My functional state is about 70% to 90% of normal. Full-time work with physical demands is not possible; full-time light work is only possible with flexible scheduling.

I have mild symptoms at rest with clear limitations in daily activities. My functional state is about 90% of normal overall, except for physically demanding tasks. Full-time work is only possible with difficulty.

I have mild symptoms at rest that worsen with exertion. Performance limitations are noticeable mainly during strenuous activities. Full-time work is possible, but roles requiring physical effort are difficult.
I have no symptoms at rest, but mild symptoms during physical or cognitive exertion. My activity level is normal overall, and I can work full-time without difficulty.

offlabel-antrag.ui.infobox.drug.agomelat:
Indications (selectable): post-infectious ME/CFS with fatigue or Long/Post-COVID with fatigue.

For agomelatine, there is a positive assessment by the Long-COVID Expert Group for these indications.

If the selected indication applies, an auxiliary application under § 2 para. 1a SGB V may not be necessary.
offlabel-antrag.ui.infobox.drug.ivabradi:
Indication: post-infectious PoTS in Long/Post-COVID (especially with beta-blocker intolerance).

For ivabradine, there is a positive assessment by the Long-COVID Expert Group for this indication.

If the selected indication applies, an auxiliary application under § 2 para. 1a SGB V may not be necessary.
offlabel-antrag.ui.infobox.drug.other:
Selecting "other medication" creates an application under § 2 para. 1a SGB V.

An application under § 2 para. 1a SGB V can also be submitted as an auxiliary path together with a regular off-label application.

This path requires a particularly robust severity and urgency justification.

Do not use generated text 1:1. Add your own sources and request a detailed medical risk-benefit assessment from your physician.
offlabel-antrag.ui.infobox.standardOfCar:
This field can also be left empty.

Regardless of the entries, a generic section is inserted that clarifies that in Germany no standard therapies from the statutory health insurance (GKV) benefit catalog are available.
offlabel-antrag.ui.infobox.drug.vortioxe:
Indications (selectable): Long/Post-COVID with cognitive impairment or Long/Post-COVID with depressive symptoms.

For vortioxetine, there is a positive assessment by the Long-COVID Expert Group for these indications.

If the selected indication applies, an auxiliary application under § 2 para. 1a SGB V may not be necessary.
offlabel-antrag.ui.infobox.selectedIndic:
These are the indications investigated in the referenced studies.

If you do not fully meet these indications but still want to submit an application, select the option that is closest to your condition.

The next question verifies again whether the indication is fully present in your case.
offlabel-antrag.ui.infobox.p2a:
**Yes:**
The chosen indication is already documented or should be confirmed in the physician report. The application then uses the indication-specific confirmation sentence.

**No:**
The application text intentionally uses a more general diagnosis/indication wording and adds an individual-case/coding note. In the physician template this is complemented by a neutral clinical-symptom wording.
offlabel-antrag.ui.infobox.section2a:
In studies, narrowly defined diagnoses are sometimes selected, for example post-infectious ME/CFS. In this application we intentionally use broader wording so the individual case can be represented more completely.

The Medical Service (MD) may still evaluate the data differently (for example ME/CFS but no Long-COVID diagnosis).

If the evidence is assessed as insufficient for the regular off-label path, an additional application under § 2 para. 1a SGB V may still be meaningful. This path is reviewed more strictly and requires a particularly robust individual-case justification.

You can find our practical assessment in the medication-specific info boxes.
offlabel-antrag.ui.intro.body:
Many people affected by this severe illness also face financial burden.

A doctor may prescribe medication outside its approved indication (off-label), but statutory health insurance may refuse reimbursement.

This is neither medical nor legal advice. Success rates for off-label applications cannot be predicted. If you urgently need medication and cannot afford it, ask your doctor whether an in-label option is possible.

This template follows the Medical Service (MD) guidance on off-label medication use. In practice, similar applications may be decided differently, including in objections. There is no guarantee of approval.

Using this template can reduce formal application errors. More consistent submissions may also help increase attention for adding medications to the off-label list.

After completion you receive three documents:
1. Application for your health insurance
2. Cover letter to your doctor requesting support
3. A template for the doctor

In addition, part 2 contains a liability waiver for signature.

Each case is individual. Additional details, especially on severity and sources, can help. Please attach supporting documents directly (e.g. care grade assessment, disability notice, medical findings).

If you select "other medication", the § 2 para. 1a SGB V hardship path is used. Requirements are stricter and chances are lower. For best chances, do not use generated text 1:1; add your own sources and a detailed risk-benefit assessment by your doctor.
